sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A ceasefire in the besieged city of Mariupol has failed for a second time in 24 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: On the 11th day of the war, fierce fighting continues to rage on between Russian and Ukrainian forces just 15 kilometers outside of the capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Plans to evacuate civilians from the besieged port city of Mariupol in eastern Ukraine have collapsed for the second time in 24 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The local ceasefire was set for 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. on Sunday, but Ukrainian officials said the assault by Russian troops had not stopped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: As the war enters its 11th day, Russia has made significant advances in the south, seeking to cut Ukraine's access to the Sea of Azov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Pro-Russian separatists claim that it is Ukraine who have denied to guarantee a ceasefire in Mariupol, once again putting the evacuation at risk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The city does not have water or heating, sparking fears of a humanitarian crisis. On the 11th day of the Kremlin's invasion of Ukraine, Russian forces continued their offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Although the Russian army has encircled major cities such as Kharkiv and Chernihiv in the north, the Ukrainian forces have managed to keep control of key cities in central and southeastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Our people, are Ukrainians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They're not retreating.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They're not giving up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They're continuing the resistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They shout to the occupiers, go home, like the Russian ship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Push them away from our territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Block their way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the capital, Kiev, hundreds of men were seen queuing to join the armed forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A government order prohibits men between 18 and 60 from leaving the country since the start of the war. Civilians and soldiers have been preparing to defend the capital as a vast Russian armored column remains stalled outside of Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Kiev is one of Moscow's main targets and Irpin, a town 15 kilometers outside of the capital, has found itself on the front line between Russian and Ukrainian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Russian army took control of the southern port city of Kherson, a move to cut off Ukraine's access to the sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Russian Ministry of defense released this video of a military base near herson claiming that the ukrainian troops left their positions abandoning nato arms moscow now claims to have seized all these weapons The eastern city of Mariupol also came under intense shelling from the Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A temporary ceasefire to create a humanitarian corridor failed as the bombing continued.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And as food stocks dwindle, Mariupol is without water and heating, sparking fears of a catastrophic humanitarian crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As war rages in Ukraine, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken pledged America's support to Moldova in a meeting with President Maia Sandu.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Blinken met with top Moldovan officials who call for security guarantees and international assistance as the country struggles to cope with high numbers of refugees fleeing Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We're working on seeing what we and allies and partners can deliver.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are looking actively now at the question of airplanes that Poland may provide to Ukraine, and looking at how we might be able to backfill should Poland decide to supply those planes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Amid growing fears of Russian military aggression, Moldova reasserted its desire for EU membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Blinken promised US support and lauded Moldova's European ambitions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Spanish public broadcaster RTVE has decided to temporarily cease activities in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is in response to a new law that carries penalties of up to 15 years in prison for publishing what authorities consider fake news about the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It is sad and painful to leave Russia like this after five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I would never have imagined having to pack my things in a few hours and having to leave in a hurry without knowing if I will be able to return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The situation is deteriorating rapidly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In the last few hours, the feeling was that either you leave now or tomorrow it might not be possible, because there might not be any flight left, the borders might be closed or martial law might be imposed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: From today, we journalists have also become Putin's target with this law that criminalizes our work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Italian television broadcaster Rai announced that it too was suspending coverage in Russia in order to ensure the safety of its journalists and to safeguard the freedom of information.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Since the start of the war in Ukraine, a massive influx of Ukrainian refugees has been arriving at the Siret border crossing in northeastern Romania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Some arrive by car, while others walk for several kilometers to escape the Russian bombings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In just 11 days, more than 63,000 people have arrived in the small town of 8,000 residents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: According to humanitarian workers, more than a thousand Ukrainian refugees cross the Danube River every day at the Izache border crossing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The UN reports that there are over 1.5 million Ukrainian refugees that have fled their country in the first 10 days of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And authorities expect the flow to increase in the coming days. We have a planning figure and I stress it's a planning figure of total four million refugees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: When we started I thought well maybe this is you know God forbid we reach that figure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's a lot but now I'm getting worried that we will.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The small border town of Chemyshol has become an almost unavoidable stopover in the exodus of Ukrainians fleeing to Poland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Many of these refugees want to join their friends or relatives already living in the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Since February 24th, more than 750,000 people have fled to Poland. Well, the number of people here at the Central Railway Station in Vyv is absolutely incredible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There are hundreds coming here every day from all parts of the country which are under attack with Kharkiv, Mariupol, Kherson, everywhere where

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: you know there are bombings and raids from the Russian troops. Now these people here are queuing to take so-called evacuation trains that will take them to bordering countries in particular to Poland, to the Polish border, which has been hosting thousands and thousands of refugees for the past 10 days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And the numbers are not likely to decrease.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And Lviv is also a hub for humanitarian aid to refugees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Actually, in the past two days, some 2,500 tons of aid have arrived from all over the world and it's being dispatched in various regions and also here where people are in the wait of finding a train.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They're staying at residence places.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: People who don't necessarily know them, but showing their solidarity, they're living in hotels and it's free, the trains are free as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So really this town is a demonstration of the solidarity, the unity of the Ukrainian people all together to face the terrible events that are ongoing and unfolding in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And unfortunately, the flow of refugees here is not likely to dwindle anytime soon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I'm Valeri Goriach from VIV for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of people took to the streets of Tel Aviv to protest the Kremlin's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Gathered in front of the Russian embassy, demonstrators carried Ukrainian flags and banners with the slogan, Stop the War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The reason I'm here is to stand against Putin, who is destroying the Ukrainian people as well as the Russian people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He is a tyrant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In New York City, thousands of people rallied in Times Square to show support to the Ukrainian people, calling for more action from the US and NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: One of the main demands, a no-fly zone over Ukraine, rejected multiple times by the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We are on a good side, and we are protecting our land.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine was always a peaceful country, always peaceful country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We never wanted war. We never, Ukrainians never attacked anybody.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In Germany, 30,000 people marched for peace in the city of Hamburg in the north.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Since the start of the war on February 24th, more than one million people in nearly 200 cities around the world have gathered to protest the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
